p: The 5-lipoxygenase (5-LOX) inhibitory activity of ‘Mato Peiyu’ leaf EO was similar between SD and SFME. Both SD-EO and SFME-EO exhibited stronger activity in the 5-LOX assay than they did in the antioxidant assays, with IC 50 values of 0.039% and 0.034% ( v/ v), respectively ( Table 5). This phenomenon was also observed in citronellal and citronellol ( Figure 2, Figure 3, Figure 4 and Figure 5). Additionally, citronellol was a stronger 5-LOX inhibitor than was citronellal, with inhibitory ratios of 79.77% and 68.25% ( v/ v), respectively, at a concentration of 0.020% ( Figure 5). The 5-LOX inhibitory ratios of the SD-CC and SFME-CC are shown in Figure 5. The contributions of the SD-CC and SFME-CC to the 5-LOX inhibitory activity of the essential oils were 71.92% and 86.47%, respectively ( Table 4). These results imply that the potent 5-LOX inhibition of the Mato Peiyu leaf essential oil was attributable the combined effects of the main components and the minor constituents, in which the major contributors were citronellal and citronellol.
